intro: Richthofenia siamensis, commonly known as the Siam richthofenia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly Thailand and Malaysia, where it thrives in tropical rainforests. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered white to yellowish flowers. It typically grows as an erect shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species, requiring conservation efforts to protect its natural environment.
